ca.ualberta.t14.gametrader

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.t14.gametrader.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AppObservable

    public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
implements AppObservable
    This obsservable class represents the Game Model which stores an inventory item's data: a game. It covers Use Cases 1.1, 4.1, 1.2: Create items that get added to your inventory (1.1) including attaching a photo (4.1) and being able to flag an item as not listed (1.4). Allow users to view their inventory (1.2) Commenting conventions taken from oracle: http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/articles/java/index-137868.html

      An enumeration of all the different video game consoles a game can be in this app.

      • getFirstPictureId

        public java.lang.String getFirstPictureId()
        Get the picture identity of the first image, he picture identity is the filename of the image json on elastic search. To be used by the model so this picture can be identified and put in a JSON and put online.
        Returns:
        a string containing the picture identity that the filename is named as, or empty if no such image is set for this game.

      • getPictureIds

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getPictureIds()
        Returns all the images associated to this game. The image ID's are the filename of these images.
        Returns:
        Array string containing all the imageIDs that are associated to this game.

      • pictureIdIsEmpty

        Returns:

      • hasPictureId

        public java.lang.Boolean hasPictureId(java.lang.String id)
        Checks whether a given imageID is associated with this game.
        Parameters:
        id - the image id to check
        Returns:
        true or false if this imageID belongs to this game or not.

      • removePictureId

        public java.lang.Boolean removePictureId(java.lang.String idToRemove,
                                Context context)
        Remove the given image from the game, and put it in the removal que so it will be removed from the database as well. The stored json file on device will also be removed.
        Parameters:
        idToRemove - The image to remove
        context - the application context from it's activity.
        Returns:
        whether the image has been successfully removed. Returns false if the image is not associated to the game and otherwise.

      • setPictureFromJson

        public java.lang.Boolean setPictureFromJson(java.lang.String jsonBitmap)
        sets the Bitmap of the game object to the json-able image given. To be used by a view when using game items from the network to retrieve the picture (if any) from the JSON format.
        Parameters:
        jsonBitmap - a string containing the byteArray of the bitmap encoded as a string in Base64.
        Returns:
        a Boolean: whether or not the image data could be decoded.

      • setPicture

        public java.lang.Boolean setPicture(Bitmap image,
                           Context context)
        Sets a picture for the game. To be used by a Controller so the user can add an image to the game item. If image given is bigger than 65536 bytes it will be scaled down to with longest edge becoming 500, the aspect ratio is kept same. If image still is bigger than 65536 bytes, it will keep scaling it down by 25 pixels with longest edge, until the file size is strictly less than 65536 bytes. It also compresses the Bitmap to JPG with 85% compression quality so its JSON-able and stores the JSON to the game object.
        Parameters:
        image - a Bitmap picture of the game.
        Returns:
        a Boolean whether the image was set or not. If false, the provided Bitmap is invalid: has a dimension that is 0.

      • addObserver

        public void addObserver(AppObserver observer)
        The Game Model is observable thus anything wanting to observe can be added to the watch list.
        Specified by:
        addObserver in interface AppObservable
        Parameters:
        observer - the observer wanting to watch this Model.

        public void deleteObserver(AppObserver o)

        The ability to remove an observer from the watch list, thus that observer will not be observing this class anymore.

        Parameters:
        o - This observer will be removed.
